intro: Trichilia weddellii var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved trichilia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Meliaceae family, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually small and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in axillary or terminal inflorescences. The fruit is a dry, woody capsule that splits open to release seeds.
